intro: Tetrastigma oliviforme, commonly known as the olive-shaped crossvine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by yellow or orange berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for horticultural study and ecological research.
